I took my time with the game and I like what I see.
I'll list the positives and negatives.

+ The gameplay is smooth and enjoyable
+ Most vehicles control well and it takes only a few moments to get used to them
+ Teamwork is encouraged
+ The game is not won by kills but by completing the objectives
+ Runs on old and new computers
+ A free game to play that is actually good
+ Not pay to win
+ Give a taste of the abilities enabled in the game (airstrikes are the best)
+ Almost no lag
+ Has a transition between first person and third person
+ Only about 1gb download

- The points system is ridiculous for prices of different weapons, abilities, etc.
- The majority of unlockables need some serious time investment (like 3 hours just for a different class)
- Vehicles are locked with no transport helicopters available at all
- The community doesn't interact well (may change in the future)
- Game glitches, has bugs and may crash
- Not many people playing at the moment
- Maps are locked
- Mediocre graphics

It may be mediocre in the graphics department but the game certainly has some good gameplay, interesting vehicles and an enjoyable experience.
I will edit this to a recommendation if they decide to be easier with the advancement as I can't recommend playing this game for so long when there is barely any reward in doing so.
It would have fared better with a pay model rather than being free to play in my opinion.

If you want a free game to satisfy that new FPS urge, this isn't as fast paced as COD, MOH or BF so it will not be for you.
If you're a fan of the older type of BF and shooters, this is a good appetizer.

reviewText:
'Red Crucible: Firestorm' is Pay-to-Win.

It has it's moments when it displays what it could potentially otherwise be but it can't hide the fact that success in this game, to a degree, can be purchased.

Premium weapons (those which are required to be bought and aren't achievable through natural game play) is the literal death of competetive matches in Red Crucible. They far out-weigh all other weapons in performance yet are accessible to anyone willing to fork out the cash. Amusingly, the devs of Red Crucible could argue that these weapons are 'theoretically' attainable by even the cheapest prick through the game credits accumulated by in-game play. However, anyone who may have played the game before will vouch that these credits (or coins) are ridiculously difficult to obtain in a mass large enough to purchase a premium weapon.

In early stages (1 - 20) a player may not notice the severe advantage a premium weapon presents to their opponent, simple skills and tactics being more than enough to equalize the disparity. It is only upon reaching levels 20 - 26 that it becomes abrupty apparent, making these levels the hardest to level up from and compete in. It is only now, after many hours wasted, that I find myself in a position to compete against anybody without the asistance of a premium gun.

I rather enjoyed the game to be honest, the matches are generally competetive and fun. Yet it is on pure principle that I can't recommend this game to anyone. Red Crucible: Firestorm isn't designed to reward effort, nor hours, and certainly not skill, but the amount of cash a kid is willing to steal from their parents.

5/10: I still play the game so can't hate too much.

Stilton, Pear and Walnut bread

(Makes one small loaf)

Ingredients:
500g Strong White Bread Flour
10g Salt
7g satchet instant yeast
20g Unsalted Butter, diced and softened
320ml water
200g Stilton Cheese
100g Walnut Peices
1 pear, peeled, cored and diced

1. Tip the flour into a large bowl. Add the salt to one side, yeast into the other. Add the butter and 3/4ths of the water, then turn the mixture with the fingers of one hand. Add the remaining water a little at a time, continuing to mix untill all the flour is taken in and the dough is soft and sticky; you may not need all the water.

2. Coat the work surface with a little oil to prevent the dough sticking. Turn out the dough and knead for at least 5 mins, until smooth and no longer sticky. Lightly oil a bowl, return the dough to it, and cover with cling film. Put in fride for an hour, so it has doubled in size.

3. Line a baking tray with grease-proof paper. Scrape the dough out of the bowl and fold it inwards again and again until all the air is knocked out and it is smooth. Add the stilton, walnut and pear peices to the dough and work them in well.

4. Shape the dough into a rectangle 30 cm long, roll it up into a sausage, then flatten it out again and roll it up a bit tighter this time. Tuck the edges under and neaten the loaf by rolling the edges to taper them slightly. Put the dogh on the baking tray with greaseproof paperwith the join underneath. Place the tray in a plastic bag and leave to prove for about 40 mins, until the loaf has doubled in size. Heat the oven too 200C, or Gas 6.

5. Just before baking, gently rub flour over the loaf, then make deep diagonal cuts alo9ng the top, first in one direction, then the other, to make a criss-cross pattern. Bake for about 30 mins, until well-risen and golden brown. Cool on a wire rack.

Early Access Review

At a glimpse you would assume its another one of those Counter Strike rip-offs, which is unfortunate for the game considering its actually not that bad.
The similarities to Battlefield are there but obviously its not as advanced, you could say, and it provides a few hours of fun.

Pros - Well it's free to play so you dont lose anything if you dont enjoy it
- Fairly balanced gameplay
- The Leveling up system and unlocks are balanced and not impossible to do without paying to win
- Vehicles are fun to use and easy to control
- Graphics are pretty good
- Controls are ok, and what you'd expect and are customisable
- The devs would appear to be hardworking and not money grabbing, and i think that is reflected in the game. there          are no paywalls that I have encountered yet, although the amount of in game currency I have so far is a little smaller than i would expect given the price of some of the buyable extras
- Servers are quite good and luckily there doesnt seem to be a push to speak feature, so you can avoid all the annoying people with a microphone

Cons - The weapon sounds are not great, i haven't unlocked all the weapons or used them all but the ones i have (the starter weapons) all have rather dissapointing sounds. None of them have got a real meaty, chugging gunshot sound and thats something i think needs to be improved
- When Sprinting (which has no limit by the way; helpful in large maps) you cannot strafe sideways which is a little confusing at start but you soon adapt so its not a huge problem
- Currency - you dont earn much of it, as i said earlier, but i guess over a long gameplay time some of the buyables become actually buyable without having to feed it real money. Saying that, the devs seem reasonablely devoted to the game and have said what money is earned from in game purchases would likely go back into supporting the game
- The menu seems a little confusing, and its kind of awkward to create loadouts as the default is only set to the basic M16 when you start
- The quick play feature seems to concentrate fully on the map Autobahn" which is a pretty good map but when you progress further in the game and unlock more maps you will probably have to find and select a server that plays them

Overall

Round up:
Graphics - 6-7/10 (Look below)
Gameplay - 9.5/10
Guns - 8/10
Physics - 7/10
Overall - 9/10 (Cos hackers) :(((((

For more details look below


Note: I have spent about 5000-6500 hours on this game on browser and about £150/$250 on stuff

Many people don't see the potential in this game. For a previously browser game (Red Crucible 2) it is exceptional.
The gameplay on this game is one of the best i have known - far surpasses any from Call of Duty. In this game there is around 10 maps i think (not sure since new updates) and all of them are so diverse from each other - One minute you could be having a close quarters gun match but then the next you could be having a tank battle in the middle of the desert. There is one flaw to the maps and that is that they (for some reason) removed Favela, which any previous players would have known that this was the best map on this game - if not one of the best for any game. And thats saying something seeming as it is a browser based game (or was). However, the CEO of Rocketeer Games has said that they would be reintroducing it to the game. Hopefully then the game will be back in its former glory.

The next thing - The guns. The diversity of guns in this game is mindblowing. These can feature from close quarters guns such as the Deagle (Which for some reason in this game is called the DEagle) to the M95 one shot sniper rifle. Gun paints are included with some weapons (which never used to be a feature) with decent designs. You can also get sights for some weapons which is epic. Only flaw to this is that they only seem to come with paid guns (or 60,000 - 100,000 honor points guns) and they cannot be bought separate or individual. So overall the guns are pretty good.
Also the suits/skins are very expensive with some only being able to be bought with money (another flaw).

The graphics: Decent enough for a browser based games. However they need top-range processors and graphics cards from my experience. I use a AMD Radeon 7500 series card and a Intel i5 processor (not very good to be fair) and i can only seem to run on lowest settings at 120fps whereas when i use medium graphics i can only run at 40fps (wtf????). So maybe this game is optimized more for Nvidea users. This is just my experience so no idea.

Hackers: The thing that lets this game down so much is that there are so many hackers. Would be great if Rocketeer introduced a new vote kicking system. I would also like to see Moderators in servers (might be in new update: ive not spent much time on)

Early Access Review

Red Crucible: Firestorm seems to be an attempt to incorporate Combat Arms, Battlefield, and Call of Duty into a free-to-play game.

I started off by playing through the tutorial, to try and get a feel for the movement, aiming, weapons, and mechanics. When the tutorial began, I was immediately greeted by the cheesy Drill Sergeant voice, you know, the one attempting to sound like a hard ♥♥♥, smokes like a train and has scars on his face. Yeah! That one! That one is tremendously annoying. Now moving on. The movement and aiming seems ancient compared to games that were released in 2005 or later, and this game was released less than one month ago on May 29th. It's as if the aiming and movement was modeled after Tom Clancys Ghost Recon Island Thunder. Granted that there are minor weapon sway animations but it feels far too scripted than it should. Lacking life essentially. Now the movement mimics the same movement from the game mentioned earlier, Tom Clancys Ghost Recon Island Thunder. It too, lacks life making the game fall below par.

Next came the character customization. It's awful. When switching between different gear and weapons, the textures fail to load and you're left with a half naked character. Seems like the developers chose to not include many of the assets with the installation. Gear must be purchased with points within the game.

Finally, the actual gameplay. I was able to get into a match fairly quickly which is a plus for the game. But it doesn't make up for what I experienced next. The vehicles accelerate unrealistically fast and the flight mechanics are just the same. The combat feels unrewarding. The sound effects are horrible and the graphics are just as bad.

Pros:
Decent performance
Uninstalls quickly
Cons:
Terrible Audio & Graphics
Subpar game mechanics which mimic games released over 10 years ago

This game is, well, kind of good. Let me explain. I will first list the positives and negatives of the game then go on to talk about my personal complications with my first through playthroughs of the game.

Positives:
+Good Gameplay, runs smoothly on old and new computers
+Downloaded super fast.
+Good community, nice people
+Doesn't really force you to pay for anything
+Nice selection of vehicles that are easy control and spawn quickly.


Negatives (Hope you are ready):
- Bad Graphics
- Horrible Sound FX
- Over used FPS cliche (the game is extremely alike to any Battlefield game)
- Not a wide choice of weaponry when you first start out (which isn't that big of a problem because most fps' are like that)
- There is only 4 maps in the entire game.
- While all vehicles are easy to maneveur they are extremely too fast and un realistic.
- You can't turn up the brightness?
- *cough cough* bad graphics.

Alright now I am going to go ahead and talk about my personal experiences, good and bad.

When I first launched the game the first thing I noticed was the menu, it's easy to use and fast and efficient, but is a little bit bland, with no sound fx on anything you click, which isn't a big deal but it's nice to have some feedback when you click something. I then went to the settings to see if I needed to change anything with the graphics. When scrolling through the options I noticed there is no brightness setting what so ever. This wasn't a problem at the time but would later prove as one later on. I then proceeded to start up the game after dicking with the settings and joined a game quickly. Sweet, didn't have to wait a long time so that means there is a good amount of people playing. When I finally got in the game this is when the brightness level was a problem, I couldn't see a thing and the brightness on my laptop was all the way up. Thankfully I just started using my mini flatscreen as my daul monitor and turned up the brightness on  it instead, perfect the game is good now. I will edit this later when I have more to complaim about. But over all I recommend this game, it just has some minor flaws to it but hey, it's free.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Red Crucible: FireStorm on STEAM

I only recommend this game if you have no other first person shooter battle game to play, It's no COD or BF, the game runs smoothly on my old XP (but it is a gaming PC). I liked this game... But this is what I found....

I could only find two maps to play on (A7 Autobahn and Kiev).

A7 Autobahn -is a place in the countryside with a couple of small villages and military camps that you could resupply at or drive tanks, APC's and a helicpoter.  (I only saw the APC),

I had a few turns in the tank and the helicopter, but it seemed to me that others were much more skilled and knew where to fire from. I killed none in those vehicles and got exploded and killed in my vehicles before I could do anything worthwhile.

Even shooting an APC enemy with my tank. I got several direct hits on the enemy, yet the APC managed to kill me exploding my vehicle in half a dozen shots. (That cannot be correct can it)?

Then I went tank -v- tank and got killed again, even though I got the first two rounds into his rear from behind before he even turned round.  Then as he turned -  one shot from him and I was gone. (I started to feel this was rarther pointless)! Did he have extra armor, the tank looked the same as the one I was driving..

I could not find out how to fire in the helicopter and it wasn't for personelle-transport-only -  I don't think.. I got killed from nowhere. Twice.. That was enough for me,,,

The best thing was on foot, I managed to kill several enemy who were on foot, but in A7 Autobahn - I could not find my rocket launcher to hit the tanks with. I had one in my load out - I'm sure...

In Kiev - On an aircraft carrier deck and below decks, you can only play on foot. I got most of my action done here. Good fun, But not much else to do.. I did not find any objective to complete or capture.. Its just Team Death Match - over and over and over again..

I think you can design you own games, but I did not do any of that. Also - although I did not use it, there is a support link and a tutorials section. If you don't use it, you only have yourself to blame. Don't go saying this is a crap game in a review - if you have not given it a chance or used support or seen the tutorials section..

I had trouble at first, because I could not get into a live match, there were no on-screen prompts to tell me how to get into the match (typical gamer - typical man - I play first then read the instructions)..  and the first few matches I tried to join, literally played out, without me actually getting in. Spectating and all that..

Then when I worked out that it was some combination of mouse left right click;  I got into the game. I still am unsure. (Is it hold right and click the left? Can't remember, even though I played just last night - for the first time).

Anyway...
Once in the game - it was great fun. However, I am not used to targeting (aiming down the sights), by pressing a mouse button. I got some good scores once I got the hang of it.

Visibility was a problem in Kiev, I did not want to adjust my graphics, because there are other games I play that I am already perfectly set up for. But, the game could have done with a brighter setting ' lighter setting to get rid of those dark corners.. .
So, its not a problem with the game! Game was great...

Also with visibility, I found that enemy were getting lost in my field of view as they ran past. 'They didn't even see me' !! Then - when I thought I had them, as I turned to chase and shoot - I'd losoe them..

I'm sure its just a mouse sensitivity thing... or screen resolution? - Possibly even refresh rate? I don't know. When you get killed you don't automatically spawn back into the game either- or at least I didn't.

Overall - I liked this game. !! It was cheap enough not to regret the price..(Did I even pay for this? Can't remember)??
I will play it a little more, but I have many more interesting games I like to play. Plus, since I am into COD and BF on the xBox, these types of games have a lot to live up to on PC..

I enjoyed the game! (Can't remember what it cost). I had the game downloaded for some time I think, before I actually got  round to playing it.. It's not the usual type of game I get for PC - usually I only like to play first person shooters on console.. Just so you know where I'm coming from..

I still have a SOD to play (State Of Decay) If you are wondering why people buy games and then don't play them. (That's me)! Three games of SOD - but only played two of them to date,,

If you liked my review and comment - THUMBS up YES my review!

I read a lot of reviews, that are not actually reviews, but are where people are complaining about their game not running, or that they want their money back because the game is not worth it, without saying why..  That's not a review - and those comments should be sent to the game dev's support..

This is a review - I told you what my game experience is with this game and what I like about it and problems I had.. Happy?  So please click the YES / Like! Look for more review by me!

Early Access Review

I gave this game a try and it seems okay. It's Early Access right now so hopefully some of the issues will get figured out before final release.

The gameplay is kind of fun but there are some definite problems that make it a bit annoying at times.

One thing I thought was annoying was how the run key isn't like a regular run key. When you hold run, you are forced to run forward. You can turn your mouse from side to side when running, but, you cannot strafe whatsoever. Also when running you can not pull up your gun at all. You have to stop to shoot, but even when stopping to shoot there is a split second where you still can't aim. This can be annoying when fighing

I also had issues with shooting over crates. Maybe it was just me, but every time I would be behind a crate and my crosshairs above, and I have someone in my sights I can't seem to ever hit them, like maybe the bullet isn't making it over the box, I am not sure.

There are a ton of items & weapons in the game. When using items, you have to buy more because they each only seem to have one use. I loved using the airstrikes, that was fun stuff. Weapons seem to unlock as you level, or may be purchased. When they unlock however, they still need to be purchased (Although I don't know if they are cheaper this way..? maybe??)

The maps are a strange situation once again. You start on Kiev and can only access that map until you level up and unlock other maps. These other unlocked maps must also be purchased either in game money or real money. It's of a strange setup because I would think that it could split the playerbase somewhat. Maybe I'm wrong.

When you level up in game, you earn gold and in game money (honor I think). When you complete a map I think you earn honor, but no gold. I made 2 levels when I was on, and got 15 gold each one. That's not really enough to get anything decent though.

Here's my very first playthrough video if you want to check it out.

https://youtu.be/6ZGkM7BRWJ0

I would recommend this game because I did have fun playing. It's a bit clunky and the animations are a little basic, but it's still in Early Access and it is Free to Play so there is no loss if you don't like it. Give it a shot, why not :)

Early Access Review

I gave this game a try and it seems okay. It's Early Access right now so hopefully some of the issues will get figured out before final release.

The gameplay is kind of fun but there are some definite problems that make it a bit annoying at times.

One thing I thought was annoying was how the run key isn't like a regular run key. When you hold run, you are forced to run forward. You can turn your mouse from side to side when running, but, you cannot strafe whatsoever. Also when running you can not pull up your gun at all. You have to stop to shoot, but even when stopping to shoot there is a split second where you still can't aim. This can be annoying when fighing

I also had issues with shooting over crates. Maybe it was just me, but every time I would be behind a crate and my crosshairs above, and I have someone in my sights I can't seem to ever hit them, like maybe the bullet isn't making it over the box, I am not sure.

There are a ton of items & weapons in the game. When using items, you have to buy more because they each only seem to have one use. I loved using the airstrikes, that was fun stuff. Weapons seem to unlock as you level, or may be purchased. When they unlock however, they still need to be purchased (Although I don't know if they are cheaper this way..? maybe??)

The maps are a strange situation once again. You start on Kiev and can only access that map until you level up and unlock other maps. These other unlocked maps must also be purchased either in game money or real money. It's of a strange setup because I would think that it could split the playerbase somewhat. Maybe I'm wrong.

When you level up in game, you earn gold and in game money (honor I think). When you complete a map I think you earn honor, but no gold. I made 2 levels when I was on, and got 15 gold each one. That's not really enough to get anything decent though.

Here's my very first playthrough video if you want to check it out.

https://youtu.be/6ZGkM7BRWJ0

I would recommend this game because I did have fun playing. It's a bit clunky and the animations are a little basic, but it's still in Early Access and it is Free to Play so there is no loss if you don't like it. Give it a shot, why not :)

First off, I've got more then 2K Hours invested into the game, but I play on the standalone and not this version, so trust me because I know what I'm talking about Mister Level 30 talking to you youngsters here.

Now for those who's wondering if it's a Pay2Win, I'll be straight with you- no, it isn't, you can work towards getting a Premium Gun unlike other games, every 7 days you get a chance to win up to 100 coins, everyday you log in you get a reward a consumable, XPs or Honor Points. So if you're super lucky, you can earn up to 1,000 coins in about 10 weeks, or save up the 15 coins you earn each time you level up.

Why does a single premium cost about 20 bucks? because they don't want the game infested with premium users, for those who want a small advantage of not showing up on the radar and more ammo capacity you'd whip out your wallet and give them about 20 bucks, but the weapon from the Class Section is just as good, just about 10 bullet less and you show up on the radar, because I'll be honest with you guys, every weapon has a tracer, so it's already pretty balanced out, it's only a big advantage in a Search and Destroy match where you arm the bomb or defuse it, and people rarely play that match.

Now if you're new and you're wondering where these 600 Honor Points weapon and armor are follow these steps carefully.

1. in the menu area, click on Character.
2. click on the UNLOCK button at the top, next to Inventory and Store.
3. and there you have it, this is where you'd find your Weapons of all Classes: Assault, Support, Sniper, Demolition- they even have your Secondary and Melee as an option.
4. this also where you unlock maps a.k.a Arena"
5. Appearence is the Armor

Ok for starters i am typing this review on this games release day and i want to say its pretty fun, just to much pay two win.
To start off this review ill list some of the pros and cons of this game so here they are.

Pros.

1. Fun gameplay and easy to learn controls
2. Wide variety of unlockable guns going from small pistols to large Machine guns
3. Decently sized mapsizes providing great vehicular battles.
4. Game is fairly optimized at its current state and will run if you have the recommended settings
5. pretty nice vehicle variety for its current state

Cons.

1. The game is very buggy and sometimes your gun will shoot the barricade 2 Ft. below you instead of what your aiming for.
2. The main menu is pretty buggy and sometimes its a hassle to navigate
3. The desync on certain servers can be bad and you will get about 900 ping and you will be constantly kicked out of servers.
4. The store tab is litterly just a bunch of overpowered pay 2 win weapons and if you want to play fair you have to go to unlockables and level up and get guns through that.
5. you cannot edit your controls so your stuck with default but i'm sure that will change soon.
6. There's no mic capability but i'm sure it will be implemented
7. There's microtransactions everywhere and all the good guns will take you years to getv to unless you spend 20 of your hard earned dollars.
